segments.text: I observe the kitchen layout, with counters and cabinets all in view.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is polishing that plate meticulously, towel bunched up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But water from the sink is cascading down the front of the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's making such a sloppy puddle on the tile floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her shoe is in it, and she doesn't even shift her weight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Stacked dishes wait on the counter, safe for now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: To her left, the upper cabinet is open, revealing the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: A boy balances precariously on a two-step stool that's wobbling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's reaching in for cookies, holding a plate in his other hand.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It looks like the stool might give way any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl beside him has her arm up, palm ready for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're conspiring together, eyes on the jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside the window, the garden path winds calmly between bushes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This domestic scene feels so ordinary yet teetering on disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR
